page.title: 04LANDSCAPE (LOWER GROUND)
page.content: ECOLOGY-LAND. A completely rural landscape of rich farmland, small fields enclosed with high, well kept hedges, or walling of dry stone or slate. There are many paths and tracks, not very well maintained and often with the stream running at the side. The land is mainly natural grazing land with some fields of cereal crops. VEGETATION. The hedgerows are of hawthorne with elder and blackberry, and the trees, in plentiful supply, are of the broad leaved deciduous variety, Rowan, Beech, Oak, Ash, and Sycamore. WILDLIFE. There is much evidence of wildlife in the area rabbits, badgers, and foxes. Birdlife is plentiful, and sparrow hawks have been seen.
